decks.notes: This deck aims to flood the board quickly with low-cost artifacts and utilize cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to boost their power and take down the opponent quickly. The combination of fast mana acceleration with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum allows for explosive starts, while cards like Etched Champion and Master of Etherium provide resilience and additional power. The deck also includes a mix of evasion and lifelink creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest to push through damage and gain life advantage.

The main focus of this UR Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal spells while efficiently drawing through your deck with cards like Thought Scour and Serum Visions. The deck also aims to gain value from powerful cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. Additionally, the deck features cards like Blood Moon to further disrupt opponent's mana base and cards like Keranos, God of Storms to provide a win condition. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible, utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck aims to chip away at the opponent's life total efficiently, with the ability to finish off the opponent with cards like Bump in the Night and Atarka's Command. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Tasigur, the Golden Fang helps disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure.

This deck focuses on aggressively dealing damage to the opponent as quickly as possible through efficient and inexpensive spells. By utilizing creatures with haste like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with a combination of burn spells such as Rift Bolt, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack prevent the opponent from gaining life or playing spells comfortably, while also dealing additional damage.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate a significant amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Oblivion Ring to disrupt the opponent's strategy while searching for key threats with Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre to close out the game. Additionally, it includes cards like Pyroclasm and Wurmcoil Engine for board control and stabilization.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of efficient creatures and disruption spells to control the board. It aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Pyromaster to generate advantage and close out games. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with opponent's threats. The manabase includes a variety of lands to support the deck's color requirements and utility lands like Raging Ravine and Ghost Quarter.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to utilize Aether Vial and creature synergy to quickly overwhelm opponents with a swarm of powerful Merfolk creatures. Spreading Seas provides disruption and card advantage, while cards like Master of Waves and Lord of Atlantis pump up the team and provide additional threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Mana Leak and Tidebinder Mage to control the board and ensure that your Merfolk can land their punches effectively. With a focus on aggression and tempo, this deck aims to win fast and decisively.

The deck focuses on assembling the Splinter Twin combo using Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite copies of the creature and win the game. It includes control elements like Snapcaster Mage, Cryptic Command, and Remand to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent. The deck also includes efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and flexible card draw with Serum Visions. Tarmogoyf provides a solid threat that can pressure the opponent while waiting to assemble the combo. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the combo to secure a win.

The main focus of this deck is to use the Splinter Twin combo with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite token copies for a quick win condition. The deck includes disruption spells like Remand and Cryptic Command to protect the combo, as well as removal cards like Lightning Bolt and Roast to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Blood Moon and Spreading Seas to disrupt opponent's mana base and slow down their game plan. Snapcaster Mage is used for additional value by recurring spells from the graveyard.

This deck focuses on setting up a combo with Splinter Twin and either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to generate infinite creature tokens with haste. The deck includes a lot of control elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and selection to help find the combo pieces more consistently. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to assemble the combo as quickly as possible while controlling the game until it can go off.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. By using a combination of cheap spells and creatures with prowess abilities, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The spell package includes cards like Serum Visions, Lightning Bolt, and Mana Leak to control the board. The creatures in the deck, such as Delver of Secrets, Snapcaster Mage, and Young Pyromancer, are used to provide additional threats and chip in damage. Overall, the deck's strategy is to be aggressive and proactive in order to win the game.

The main focus of this UR Storm deck is to quickly generate mana and storm count using cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Goblin Electromancer, while digging through the deck with cantrips like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand. The goal is to build up a high storm count and then finish the game with a lethal Grapeshot. Past in Flames is also included to provide additional storm count and allow for multiple uses of spells in the graveyard. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, utilizing removal spells, and using Snapcaster Mage to re-use important spells. The deck runs efficient removal spells like Path to Exile, Lightning Bolt, and Lightning Helix. It also includes counterspells like Remand, Mana Leak, and Cryptic Command to control the board. The deck has a strong finisher in Sphinx's Revelation and powerful planeswalkers like Ajani Vengeant and Gideon Jura. Celestial Colonnade provides a strong win condition while also serving as a blocker.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and utilizing versatile creatures to apply pressure and draw cards. It aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient card advantage and strong interaction. The mana base is constructed to support a variety of colors while maintaining consistency. In addition, the inclusion of powerful planeswalkers and evasive creatures like Vendilion Clique and Dragonlord Ojutai provides additional win conditions and flexibility in different matchups. Overall, the deck seeks to outmaneuver opponents and dictate the pace of the game.
